intro: Kaviria tomentosa subsp. takhtadshanii, commonly known as the Afghan woolly bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to local biodiversity. The subspecies is noted for its resilience to harsh climatic conditions, making it a hardy and adaptable plant in its native habitat.
